about.summary: Digital repeat photography and near-surface remote sensing have been used by environmental scientists to study the environmental change for nearly a decade. However, a user-friendly, reliable, and robust platform to extract color-based statistics and time-series from a large stack of images is still lacking. Here, we present an interactive open-source toolkit, called 'xROI', that facilitate the process time-series extraction and improve the quality of the final data. 'xROI' provides a responsive environment for scientists to interactively a) delineate regions of interest (ROI), b) handle field of view (FOV) shifts, and c) extract and export time series data characterizing image color (i.e. red, green and blue channel digital numbers for the defined ROI). Using 'xROI', user can detect FOV shifts without minimal difficulty. The software gives user the opportunity to readjust the mask files or redraw new ones every time an FOV shift occurs. 'xROI' helps to significantly improve data accuracy and continuity.

Digital repeat photography and near-surface remote sensing have been used by environmental scientists to study the environmental change for nearly a decade. However, a user-friendly, reliable, and robust platform to extract color-based statistics and time-series from a large stack of images is still lacking. Here, we present an interactive open-source toolkit, called 'xROI', that facilitate the process time-series extraction and improve the quality of the final data. 'xROI' provides a responsive environment for scientists to interactively a) delineate regions of interest (ROI), b) handle field of view (FOV) shifts, and c) extract and export time series data characterizing image color (i.e. red, green and blue channel digital numbers for the defined ROI). Using 'xROI', user can detect FOV shifts without minimal difficulty. The software gives user the opportunity to readjust the mask files or redraw new ones every time an FOV shift occurs. 'xROI' helps to significantly improve data accuracy and continuity.

name: r-xroi
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.9.20' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-xroi
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/xROI_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/xROI/xROI_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b06068b950f40b8af8f68a7bd25436f8f4971cc95701b33d766bf5c235164175

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcurl
    - r-colourpicker
    - r-data.table
    - r-jpeg
    - r-lubridate
    - r-moments
    - r-raster
    - r-rgdal
    - r-rjson
    - r-shiny
    - r-shinyjs
    - r-sp
    - r-stringr
    - r-tiff
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcurl
    - r-colourpicker
    - r-data.table
    - r-jpeg
    - r-lubridate
    - r-moments
    - r-raster
    - r-rgdal
    - r-rjson
    - r-shiny
    - r-shinyjs
    - r-sp
    - r-stringr
    - r-tiff

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('xROI')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('xROI')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=xROI
  license: AGPL-3.0
  summary: Digital repeat photography and near-surface remote sensing have been used by environmental
    scientists to study the environmental change for nearly a decade. However, a user-friendly,
    reliable, and robust platform to extract color-based statistics and time-series
    from a large stack of images is still lacking. Here, we present an interactive open-source
    toolkit, called 'xROI', that facilitate the process time-series extraction and improve
    the quality of the final data. 'xROI' provides a responsive environment for scientists
    to interactively a) delineate regions of interest (ROI), b) handle field of view
    (FOV) shifts, and c) extract and export time series data characterizing image color
    (i.e. red, green and blue channel digital numbers for the defined ROI). Using 'xROI',
    user can detect FOV shifts without minimal difficulty. The software gives user the
    opportunity to readjust the mask files or redraw new ones every time an FOV shift
    occurs. 'xROI' helps to significantly improve data accuracy and continuity.
  license_family: AGPL
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/AGPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: xROI
# Title: Delineate Region of Interests (ROI's) and Extract Time-Series Data from Digital Repeat Photography Images
# Version: 0.9.20
# Date: 2021-06-01
# Author: Bijan Seyednasrollah, Thomas Milliman, Andrew D. Richardson
# Maintainer: Bijan Seyednasrollah <bijan.s.nasr@gmail.com>
# Description: Digital repeat photography and near-surface remote sensing have been used by environmental scientists to study the environmental change for nearly a decade. However, a user-friendly, reliable, and robust platform to extract color-based statistics and time-series from a large stack of images is still lacking. Here, we present an interactive open-source toolkit, called 'xROI', that facilitate the process time-series extraction and improve the quality of the final data. 'xROI' provides a responsive environment for scientists to interactively a) delineate regions of interest (ROI), b) handle field of view (FOV) shifts, and c) extract and export time series data characterizing image color (i.e. red, green and blue channel digital numbers for the defined ROI). Using 'xROI', user can detect FOV shifts without minimal difficulty. The software gives user the opportunity to readjust the mask files or redraw new ones every time an FOV shift occurs. 'xROI' helps to significantly improve data accuracy and continuity.
# Depends: R (>= 4.0.0)
# Imports: colourpicker, data.table, graphics, jpeg, lubridate, methods, moments, RCurl, raster, rgdal, rjson, sp, stats, stringr, tiff, utils, shiny, shinyjs,
# Suggests: knitr, testthat, rmarkdown, shinyBS, shinyAce, shinyTime, shinyFiles, shinydashboard, shinythemes, plotly
# License: AGPL-3
# Encoding: UTF-8
# BugReports: https://github.com/bnasr/xROI/issues
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2021-06-02 01:55:30 UTC; bijan
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2021-06-02 04:30:02 UTC
